alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Floyd; Franklin (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 28 at 8:52AM EDT until August 28 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...River and stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Portions of north central North Carolina, including the following counties, Rockingham, Stokes and Surry. Portions of Virginia, including the following counties, Carroll, Floyd, Franklin, Henry and Patrick. * WHEN...Until 245 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding in the Woolwine area of Patrick County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 846 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen, with localized amounts of in excess of 10 inches. Numerous roads are flooded and closed in Patrick County due to the widespread heavy rainfall, including in the communities of Woolwine and Ararat. Significant flooding is occurring along the Ararat River in Surry County. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Airy, Elkin, Fairview, Flat Rock, Jonesville, Dobson and Pilot Mountain. - For flooding safety information, please visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
